title: Slayer master

properties.name: description
properties.value: Slayer Masters are NPCs who serve as guides to the Slayer skill & assign tasks to players requiring them to kill specific monsters a certain number of times. Each Slayer Master has a different combat level requirement for players to be assigned tasks from them. Slayer Masters with higher combat level requirements will generally assign longer tasks with more difficult monsters. Players receive Slayer reward points upon completing tasks with bonus points being awarded at regular intervals (except for tasks from Turael and Spria). These points can be redeemed for a variety of different rewards, unlocks, & upgrades which enhance a player's Slayer experience.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Slayer master
This article is about the NPCs that give Slayer tasks. For the term for a player with level 99 Slayer, see Slayer cape.

Slayer Masters are NPCs who serve as guides to the Slayer skill & assign tasks to players requiring them to kill specific monsters a certain number of times. Each Slayer Master has a different combat level requirement for players to be assigned tasks from them. Slayer Masters with higher combat level requirements will generally assign longer tasks with more difficult monsters. Players receive Slayer reward points upon completing tasks with bonus points being awarded at regular intervals (except for tasks from Turael and Spria). These points can be redeemed for a variety of different rewards, unlocks, & upgrades which enhance a player's Slayer experience.

All Slayer masters sell items which are helpful & sometimes essential to specific Slayer tasks. There is a separate article for the Slayer Equipment.

Contents

  • 2 Turael

Slayer Masters[edit | edit source]

Slayer Master Combat level required Points per Task Notes
Turael None 0
Spria None 0 Requires completion of A Porcine of Interest
Krystilia None 25 All tasks are within the Wilderness

Monsters can drop Larran's key

Assignments use a separate task completion counter than assignments from other Slayer masters

Mazchna 20[n 1] 2 Requires completion of Priest in Peril
Vannaka 40[n 1] 4
Chaeldar 70[n 1] 10 Requires completion of Lost City
Konar 75[n 1] 18 (20 with Elite Kourend & Kebos Diary) Monsters must be killed in specified locations

Monsters can drop brimstone keys

Nieve/Steve[n 2] 85[n 1] 12 (15 with Elite Western Provinces Diary)
Duradel 100 and level 50 Slayer[n 1] 15 Requires completion of Shilo Village
  1. ↑ 1.0 1.1 1.2 1.3 1.4 1.5 The combat level requirement can be bypassed by achieving 99 Slayer and showing the Slayer master the Slayer cape.
  2. ↑ After the events of Monkey Madness II, Steve replaces Nieve as the Slayer master in the Tree Gnome Stronghold. Information on Steve as a Slayer master can be found below.

Turael[edit | edit source]

The location of Turael.

Turael gives the easiest Slayer tasks and is ideal for lower level players. They have no minimum combat or Slayer level requirements before players may receive assignments.

If a player of any level receives an assignment they do not wish to do, Turael may consider giving players an easier assignment if they talk to him effectively "skipping" the hardest assignment. However, this only works if the assignment is something that he doesn't assign. For example, if Chaeldar assigns a player Desert Lizards, then the Burthorpe Slayer master cannot change their task, as he too assigns Desert Lizards. However, if the number given is far greater than Turael would normally give, it is possible to change your task. For example, if Duradel assigns 140+ Kalphite, then Turael will change this, as he would not assign that many to kill. In this case, Turael will give a new assignment, which could be a new creature to slay or fewer of the same creature. Note that it is impossible for a player to get Turael to reassign a task that he gave out.

He is located in a small house south of the general store in Burthorpe. The fastest ways to reach him are to use:

  • A Games necklace to the Burthorpe Games Room, down the stairs and run east.
  • A Combat bracelet to teleport to the Warriors' Guild and run east.

Slayer points[edit | edit source]

Completion of a task assigned by Turael will not grant any Slayer points. As well, if it was a task replacing one from another master your task streak will be reset. So, if you're on the 48th task and take a replacement one from Turael, your completed tasks will be set to 0.

Spria[edit | edit source]

The location of Spria.

Spria is Turael's daughter, and has the same task list as him. She plays a role in the quest A Porcine of Interest.

She is located in a small house in Draynor Village. The fastest ways to reach her are to use:

  • An amulet of glory to Draynor Village.
  • An explorer's ring to teleport to the Falador cabbage patch and run southeast.
  • A necklace of passage to the Wizards' Tower and run north.
  • Lumbridge Teleport and run west.

Slayer points[edit | edit source]

Completion of a task assigned by Spria will not grant any Slayer points.

Krystilia[edit | edit source]

The location of Krystilia.

Krystilia's tasks come with a risk: tasks assigned by her must be done within the Wilderness. She has no minimum combat or Slayer level requirements, and doesn't factor in the player's combat level, meaning she may give players tasks much harder than their combat level would otherwise indicate.

While completing Krystilia's tasks, players may obtain Larran's keys, the drop rate of which is dependent on the monster's combat level. They can be used to open a small or big chest for additional rewards.

Assignments from her have a separate task completion counter than assignments from other Slayer masters, so players will have to complete five of her Slayer assignments to begin earning Slayer reward points. If the player chooses to reset an assignment Krystilia gives before the five assignments are completed, the counter will reset to zero and the player will need to complete five more tasks before they will receive reward points.

She can be found by the jailhouse in Edgeville, north-east of the bank. The fastest ways to reach her are to use:

  • An amulet of glory teleport to Edgeville.
  • The fairy ring code DKR, and run west over the river.
  • The Paddewwa Teleport from the Ancient Spellbook, then exit the dungeon and run north.
  • One of the canoe spots on the River Lum.

Slayer points[edit | edit source]

Completion of a task assigned by Krystilia grants:

  • 25 points per task
  • 125 for every 10th
  • 375 for every 50th
  • 625 for every 100th
  • 875 for every 250th
  • 1,250 for every 1,000th

Mazchna[edit | edit source]

The location of Mazchna.

Mazchna is the third easiest Slayer Master. The minimum combat level requirement to be assigned tasks from him is 20.

Mazchna is located north-east of Canifis. The fastest ways to reach him are to use:

  • The Kharyrll teleport from the Ancient Spellbook.
  • The fairy ring code CKS, arriving west of Canifis.
  • The Salve Graveyard Teleport or Fenkenstrain's Castle Teleport from the Arceuus spellbook.
  • An Ectophial to arrive at the Ectofuntus, and run west.
  • The charter ship to Port Phasmatys, and run west.

Slayer points[edit | edit source]

Completion of a task assigned by Mazchna grants:

  • 2 Slayer points per normal task
  • 5 for every 10th
  • 15 for every 50th
  • 50 for every 100th
  • 70 for every 250th
  • 100 for every 1,000th

Vannaka[edit | edit source]

The location of Vannaka.

Vannaka is a mid-level Slayer Master. The minimum combat level requirement to be assigned tasks from Vannaka is 40.

He is located in the Edgeville Dungeon, east of the Wilderness gate. The fastest ways to reach him are to use:

  • An amulet of glory teleport to Edgeville, north of the dungeon entrance.
  • The fairy ring code DKR, arriving east of Edgeville.
  • Using the Paddewwa Teleport, teleporting you inside of the dungeon.
  • Mini-game teleport to Soul Wars.

Slayer points[edit | edit source]

Completion of a task assigned by Vannaka grants:

  • 4 Slayer points per normal task
  • 20 for every 10th
  • 60 for every 50th
  • 100 points per 100th task
  • 140 points per 250th task
  • 200 points per 1,000th task

Chaeldar[edit | edit source]

The location of Chaeldar.

Chaeldar is a mid-level Slayer Master. To be assigned monsters from her, you must have completed Lost City and have a minimum combat level of 70.

She is located in Zanaris by the Fairy Queen's Throne. The only ways to reach her are to use any fairy ring to go to Zanaris, or entering the shed in the Lumbridge Swamp whilst wielding a Dramen staff or Lunar staff.

Slayer points[edit | edit source]

Completion of a task assigned by Chaeldar grants:

  • 10 Slayer points per normal task
  • 50 for every 10th
  • 150 for every 50th
  • 250 points per 100th task
  • 350 points per 250th task
  • 500 points per 1,000th task

Konar quo Maten[edit | edit source]

The location of Konar quo Maten.

Konar quo Maten is the third hardest Slayer Master. To receive Slayer tasks from her, a combat level of 75 is required.

Konar is unique amongst the primary Slayer masters in the fact that in addition to assigning a monster, she will also assign one of multiple locations (if the monster can be found in other places). She will never direct players into the Wilderness, unless it is part of boss Slayer, as that is Krystilia's assignment location.

While completing Konar's tasks, players may obtain a brimstone key, which are obtained and have drop rates similar to Larran's keys. They are used to open the brimstone chest near her for additional rewards.

She is located on the summit of Mount Karuulm. The fastest ways to reach the summit are to use:

  • Rada's blessing 3 or 4 to teleport to Mount Karuulm.
  • The fairy ring code CIR, arriving south of Mount Karuulm.
  • A skills necklace or Farming cape to teleport to the Farming Guild and run north-east.

Slayer points[edit | edit source]

Completion of a task assigned by Konar quo Maten grants:

  • 18 (20)[b 1] Slayer points per normal task
  • 90 (100)[b 1] for every 10th
  • 270 (300)[b 1] for every 50th
  • 450 (500)[b 1] points per 100th task
  • 630 (700)[b 1] points per 250th task
  • 900 (1,000)[b 1] points per 1,000th task
  1. ↑ 1.0 1.1 1.2 1.3 1.4 1.5 After completing the Elite Kourend & Kebos Diary, players will have an increased number of points received per task.

Nieve/Steve[edit | edit source]

The location of Nieve/Steve.

Nieve is the second hardest Slayer Master. The minimum combat level requirement to be assigned tasks from Nieve is 85. After the events of Monkey Madness II, Steve replaces Nieve as the Slayer master.

She is located in the Tree Gnome Stronghold, near the yew trees and the southern bank. The fastest ways to reach her are to use:

  • A Slayer ring teleport to the Stronghold Slayer Cave.
  • A charged Necklace of passage to Jorral's Outpost, then run north.
  • The Balloon Transport System to the Grand Tree.
  • A Spirit tree to the Tree Gnome Stronghold and run south-west.
  • A Gnome Glider to the Grand Tree and run south-west after leaving the grand tree.

Slayer points[edit | edit source]

Completion of a task assigned by Nieve grants:

  • 12 (15)[c 1] Slayer points per normal task
  • 60 (75)[c 1] for every 10th
  • 180 (225)[c 1] for every 50th
  • 300 (375)[c 1] for every 100th
  • 420 (525)[c 1] for every 250th
  • 600 (750)[c 1] for every 1,000th
  1. ↑ 1.0 1.1 1.2 1.3 1.4 1.5 After completing the Elite Western Provinces Diary, players will have an increased number of points received per task, equivalent to that of Duradel.

Duradel[edit | edit source]

The location of Duradel.

Duradel is the hardest Slayer Master. To be assigned tasks from Duradel, players must have a Slayer level of at least 50, and a combat level of at least 100. Also, to be able to enter Shilo Village, where Duradel resides, players must have completed the Shilo Village quest.

He is located on the platform bridging the river at the fishing shop in Shilo Village. Although Duradel is usually north of the river (or sometimes on the bridge), he cannot be accessed from north of the river. Instead, enter the fishing shop south of the river, climb the ladder there, and cross the bridge to get to him.

The fastest ways to reach Shilo Village are to use:

  • Karamja gloves 4 to teleport directly to Duradel.
  • Karamja gloves 3 to teleport to the Shilo Village mine.
  • The Shilo Village cart system to Shilo Village from the north end of Brimhaven.
  • Fairy ring code CKR, arriving west of Shilo Village.

Slayer points[edit | edit source]

Completion of a task assigned by Duradel grants:

  • 15 Slayer points per normal task
  • 75 for every 10th
  • 225 for every 50th
  • 375 for every 100th
  • 525 for every 250th
  • 750 for every 1,000th

Notes[edit | edit source]

  • Duradel is the only Slayer Master with a Slayer level requirement, all other masters can be utilized at Level 1 Slayer provided that the player has the appropriate Combat Level and meets any other requirements.
  • Players can use the Lunar spell NPC Contact to receive a new task or updates on their current task from any Slayer Master, this is considered the most efficient way of receiving tasks as it does not require the player to travel to the appropriate NPC.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
29 January 2015
(update | poll)

Slayer masters now have a right-click option, Assignment, that allows you to quickly check progress on your current task or start a new one.

22 February 2013
(update)

This content was included when the Old School RuneScape servers officially launched.

These points can be redeemed for a variety of different rewards, unlocks, & upgrades which enhance a player's Slayer experience.

All Slayer masters sell items which are helpful & sometimes essential to specific Slayer tasks. There is a separate article for the [[Slayer Equipment]].

==Turael==
[[File:Turael chathead.png|left]]
{{Map|name=Slayer master|x=2932|y=3537|plane=0|r=3|width=250|height=250|align=right|caption=The location of Turael.|mtype=square}}
[[Turael]] gives the easiest Slayer tasks and is ideal for lower level players. They have no minimum combat or Slayer level requirements before players may receive assignments.

If a player of any level receives an assignment they do not wish to do, Turael may consider giving players an easier assignment if they talk to him effectively "skipping" the hardest assignment. However, this only works if the assignment is something that he doesn't assign. For example, if Chaeldar assigns a player [[Desert Lizard]]s, then the Burthorpe Slayer master cannot change their task, as he too assigns Desert Lizards. However, if the number given is far greater than Turael would normally give, it ''is'' possible to change your task. For example, if Duradel assigns 140+ [[Kalphite]], then Turael '''will''' change this, as he would not assign that many to kill. In this case, Turael will give a new assignment, which could be a new creature to slay or fewer of the same creature. Note that it is impossible for a player to get Turael to reassign a task that he gave out.

He is located in a small house south of the [[general store]] in [[Burthorpe]]. The fastest ways to reach him are to use:

*A [[Games necklace]] to the [[Burthorpe Games Room]], down the stairs and run east.
*A [[Combat bracelet]] to teleport to the [[Warriors' Guild]] and run east.

===Slayer points===
Completion of a task assigned by Turael '''will not''' grant any Slayer points. As well, if it was a task replacing one from another master your [[Slayer reward point|task streak]] will be '''reset'''. So, if you're on the 48th task and take a replacement one from Turael, your completed tasks will be set to 0.

==Spria==

{{Map|name=Slayer master|x=3092|y=3268|plane=0|r=3|width=250|height=250|align=right|caption=The location of Spria.|mtype=square}}
[[Spria]] is Turael's daughter, and has the same task list as him. She plays a role in the quest [[A Porcine of Interest]].

She is located in a small house in [[Draynor Village]]. The fastest ways to reach her are to use:

*An [[amulet of glory]] to [[Draynor Village]].
*An [[explorer's ring]] to teleport to the [[Falador cabbage patch]] and run southeast.
*A [[necklace of passage]] to the [[Wizards' Tower]] and run north.

Completion of a task assigned by Spria '''will not''' grant any Slayer points.

==Krystilia==
[[File:Krystilia chathead.png|left]]
{{Map|name=Slayer master|x=3110|y=3516|plane=0|r=3|width=250|height=250|align=right|caption=The location of Krystilia.|mtype=square}}
[[Krystilia]]'s tasks come with a risk: tasks assigned by her '''must''' be done within the [[Wilderness]]. She has no minimum combat or Slayer level requirements, and doesn't factor in the player's combat level, meaning she may give players tasks much harder than their combat level would otherwise indicate.

While completing Krystilia's tasks, players may obtain [[Larran's key]]s, the drop rate of which is dependent on the monster's combat level. They can be used to open a [[Larran's small chest|small]] or [[Larran's big chest|big chest]] for additional rewards.

Assignments from her have a separate task completion counter than assignments from other Slayer masters, so players will have to complete five of her Slayer assignments to begin earning Slayer reward points. If the player chooses to reset an assignment Krystilia gives before the five assignments are completed, the counter will reset to zero and the player will need to complete five more tasks before they will receive reward points.

She can be found by the jailhouse in [[Edgeville]], north-east of the bank. The fastest ways to reach her are to use:

*An [[amulet of glory]] teleport to Edgeville.
*The [[fairy ring]] code {{fairycode|DKR}}, and run west over the river.
*The [[Paddewwa Teleport]] from the [[Ancient Magicks|Ancient Spellbook]], then exit the dungeon and run north.
*One of the [[canoe]] spots on the [[River Lum]].

Completion of a task assigned by Krystilia grants:

*25 points per task
*125 for every 10th
*375 for every 50th
*625 for every 100th
*875 for every 250th
*1,250 for every 1,000th

She is located in [[Zanaris]] by the [[Fairy Queen|Fairy Queen's]] Throne. The only ways to reach her are to use any [[Fairy ring|fairy ring]] to go to Zanaris, or entering the shed in the [[Lumbridge Swamp]] whilst wielding a [[Dramen staff]] or [[Lunar staff]].

[[Konar quo Maten]] is the third hardest Slayer Master. To receive [[Slayer task]]s from her, a [[combat level]] of 75 is required.

Konar is unique amongst the primary Slayer masters in the fact that in addition to assigning a monster, she will also assign one of multiple locations (if the monster can be found in other places). She will never direct players into the Wilderness, unless it is part of boss Slayer, as that is Krystilia's assignment location.

While completing Konar's tasks, players may obtain a [[brimstone key]], which are obtained and have drop rates similar to [[Larran's key]]s. They are used to open the [[brimstone chest]] near her for additional rewards.

She is located on the summit of [[Mount Karuulm]]. The fastest ways to reach the summit are to use:

*[[Rada's blessing 3]] or [[Rada's blessing 4|4]] to teleport to [[Mount Karuulm]].
*The [[fairy ring]] code {{fairycode|CIR}}, arriving south of [[Mount Karuulm]].
*A [[skills necklace]] or [[Farming cape]] to teleport to the [[Farming Guild]] and run north-east.

===Slayer points===
Completion of a task assigned by Konar quo Maten grants:

*18 (20){{Refn|After completing the Elite [[Kourend & Kebos Diary]], players will have an increased number of points received per task.|name=Konar quo Maten|group=b}} Slayer points per normal task
*90 (100){{NamedRef|Konar quo Maten|group=b}} for every 10th
*270 (300){{NamedRef|Konar quo Maten|group=b}} for every 50th
*450 (500){{NamedRef|Konar quo Maten|group=b}} points per 100th task

*900 (1,000){{NamedRef|Konar quo Maten|group=b}} points per 1,000th task

==Nieve/Steve==
[[File:Nieve_chathead.png|left]]
{{Map|name=Slayer master|x=2432|y=3424|r=2|width=250|height=250|align=right|caption=The location of Nieve/Steve.|mtype=square}}
[[Nieve]] is the second hardest Slayer Master. The minimum combat level requirement to be assigned tasks from Nieve is 85. After the events of [[Monkey Madness II]], [[Steve]] replaces Nieve as the Slayer master.

She is located in the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]], near the yew trees and the southern bank. The fastest ways to reach her are to use:

*A [[Slayer ring]] teleport to the [[Stronghold Slayer Cave]].
*A charged [[Necklace of passage]] to [[Outpost|Jorral's Outpost]], then run north.
*The [[Balloon Transport System]] to the [[Grand Tree]].
*A [[Spirit tree]] to the Tree Gnome Stronghold and run south-west.
*A [[Gnome Glider]] to the Grand Tree and run south-west after leaving the grand tree.

===Slayer points===
Completion of a task assigned by Nieve grants:

*12 (15){{Refn|After completing the Elite [[Western Provinces Diary]], players will have an increased number of points received per task, equivalent to that of [[Duradel]].|name=Nieve/Steve|group=c}} Slayer points per normal task
*60 (75){{NamedRef|Nieve/Steve|group=c}} for every 10th
*180 (225){{NamedRef|Nieve/Steve|group=c}} for every 50th
*300 (375){{NamedRef|Nieve/Steve|group=c}} for every 100th
*420 (525){{NamedRef|Nieve/Steve|group=c}} for every 250th
*600 (750){{NamedRef|Nieve/Steve|group=c}} for every 1,000th
{{Reflist|group=c}}

==Duradel==
[[File:Duradel_chathead.png|left]]
{{Map|name=Slayer master|x=2869|y=2982|r=3|plane=1|width=250|height=250|align=right|caption=The location of Duradel.|mtype=square}}
[[Duradel]] is the hardest Slayer Master. To be assigned tasks from Duradel, players must have a Slayer level of at least 50, and a combat level of at least 100. Also, to be able to enter [[Shilo Village (location)|Shilo Village]], where Duradel resides, players must have completed the [[Shilo Village]] quest.

He is located on the platform bridging the river at the fishing shop in Shilo Village. Although Duradel is usually north of the river (or sometimes on the bridge), he cannot be accessed from north of the river. Instead, enter the fishing shop south of the river, climb the ladder there, and cross the bridge to get to him.

The fastest ways to reach Shilo Village are to use:

*[[Karamja gloves 4]] to teleport directly to Duradel.
*[[Karamja gloves 3]] to teleport to the [[Shilo Village mine]].
*The [[Shilo Village cart system]] to Shilo Village from the north end of [[Brimhaven]].
*[[Fairy ring]] code {{fairycode|CKR}}, arriving west of Shilo Village.

===Slayer points===
Completion of a task assigned by Duradel grants:

*15 Slayer points per normal task
*75 for every 10th
*225 for every 50th
*375 for every 100th
*525 for every 250th
*750 for every 1,000th

==Notes==
* Duradel is the only Slayer Master with a Slayer level requirement, all other masters can be utilized at Level 1 Slayer provided that the player has the appropriate [[Combat Level]] and meets any other requirements.
* Players can use the [[Lunar spell]] [[NPC Contact]] to receive a new task or updates on their current task from any Slayer Master, this is considered the most efficient way of receiving tasks as it does not require the player to travel to the appropriate NPC.
